page.title: 08NAILSTONE COLLIERY - HISTORY
page.content:
In 1861 two shafts were sunk, they drilled through soil, sand, boulders, clay and water. Two shafts were needed for{ventilation}as air was drawn down one and up the other. This was done by lighting a fire to draw the air down, but by the early 1900s air pumps were in use.
The first miners used picks, shovels, forks and explosives. They used to crawl on hands and knees. The coal was pulled along in tubs by pit ponies in the early 1900s. In 1899 coal was supplied to the London North Western Railway, which transported 30,00 tons of coal each year. The line ( removed in the early 1980s ) was constructed in 1832 as part of the {New Swannington Line,}by George Stephenson.
